1.verse: The Song of songs, which is Solomonâ€™s.

2.verse: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth;

3.verse: Thine oils have a goodly fragrance;

4.verse: Draw me; we will run after thee:

6.verse: Look not upon me, because I am swarthy,

7.verse: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth,

8.verse: If thou know not, O thou fairest among women,

9.verse: I have compared thee, O my love,

10.verse: Thy cheeks are comely with plaits of hair ,

11.verse: We will make thee plaits of gold

12.verse: While the king sat at his table,

13.verse: My beloved is unto me as a bundle of myrrh,

14.verse: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of henna-flowers

15.verse: Behold, thou art fair, my love;

16.verse: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant:

17.verse: The beams of our house are cedars,

1.verse: I am a rose of Sharon,

3.verse: As the apple-tree among the trees of the wood,

4.verse: He brought me to the banqueting-house,

5.verse: Stay ye me with raisins, refresh me with apples;

6.verse: His left hand is under my head,

7.verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

8.verse: The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh,

9.verse: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart:

10.verse: My beloved spake, and said unto me,

11.verse: For, lo, the winter is past;

12.verse: The flowers appear on the earth;

13.verse: The fig-tree ripeneth her green figs,

14.verse: O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock,

15.verse: Take us the foxes, the little foxes,

16.verse: My beloved is mine, and I am his:

17.verse: Until the day be cool, and the shadows flee away,

2.verse: I said , I will rise now, and go about the city;

3.verse: The watchmen that go about the city found me;

4.verse: It was but a little that I passed from them,

5.verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

6.verse: Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness

7.verse: Behold, it is the litter of Solomon;

8.verse: They all handle the sword, and are expert in war:

9.verse: King Solomon made himself a palanquin

10.verse: He made the pillars thereof of silver,

11.verse: Go forth, O ye daughters of Zion, and behold king Solomon,

1.verse: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair;

2.verse: Thy teeth are like a flock of ewes that are newly shorn,

3.verse: Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet,

4.verse: Thy neck is like the tower of David

5.verse: Thy two breasts are like two fawns

6.verse: Until the day be cool, and the shadows flee away,

7.verse: Thou art all fair, my love;

8.verse: Come with me from Lebanon, my bride,

9.verse: Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my bride;

10.verse: How fair is thy love, my sister, my bride!

11.verse: Thy lips, O my bride, drop as the honeycomb:

12.verse: A garden shut up is my sister, my bride;

13.verse: Thy shoots are an orchard of pomegranates, with precious fruits;

15.verse: Thou art a fountain of gardens,

16.verse: Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south;

1.verse: I am come into my garden, my sister, my bride:

2.verse: I was asleep, but my heart waked:

3.verse: I have put off my garment; how shall I put it on?

4.verse: My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door ,

5.verse: I rose up to open to my beloved;

7.verse: The watchmen that go about the city found me,

8.verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

9.verse: What is thy beloved more than another beloved,

10.verse: My beloved is white and ruddy,

11.verse: His head is as the most fine gold;

12.verse: His eyes are like doves beside the water-brooks,

13.verse: His cheeks are as a bed of spices,

14.verse: His hands are as rings of gold set with beryl:

15.verse: His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold:

2.verse: My beloved is gone down to his garden,

3.verse: I am my belovedâ€™s, and my beloved is mine:

4.verse: Thou art fair, O my love, as Tirzah,

5.verse: Turn away thine eyes from me,

6.verse: Thy teeth are like a flock of ewes,

7.verse: Thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate

8.verse: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines,

9.verse: My dove, my undefiled, is but one;

10.verse: Who is she that looketh forth as the morning,

11.verse: I went down into the garden of nuts,

12.verse: Before I was aware, my soul set me

1.verse: How beautiful are thy feet in sandals, O princeâ€™s daughter!

2.verse: Thy body is like a round goblet,

3.verse: Thy two breasts are like two fawns

4.verse: Thy neck is like the tower of ivory;

5.verse: Thy head upon thee is like Carmel,

6.verse: How fair and how pleasant art thou,

7.verse: This thy stature is like to a palm-tree,

8.verse: I said, I will climb up into the palm-tree,

9.verse: And thy mouth like the best wine,

11.verse: Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field;

12.verse: Let us get up early to the vineyards;

1.verse: Oh that thou wert as my brother,

2.verse: I would lead thee, and bring thee into my motherâ€™s house,

3.verse: His left hand should be under my head,

4.verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem,

5.verse: Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness,

6.verse: Set me as a seal upon thy heart,

10.verse: I am a wall, and my breasts like the towers thereof :

11.verse: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon;

12.verse: My vineyard, which is mine, is before me:

13.verse: Thou that dwellest in the gardens,
